page.title: 15ENTERTAINMENT in Withington
page.content: Most of the entertainment which takes place in the area is centered on the {Village Hall,}which was built in 1966. It is run by a voluntary comittee of 20 local people and maintained by one person who is paid from the Hall fund. Throughout the year there are certain major functions such as the{Rose } {Festival}which is held on the 1st Saturday in July and followed by the long standing{Gooseberry Show,}which first took place in the previous village hall in 1883, on the last Saturday in July. There are smaller {functions}held on a regular basis either weekly, such as Bingo which is run alternatly by the Parish Council and the Gooseberry Society in order to raise funds. A Dancing Class is held every Monday and each month the local branch of the Women's Institute meets in the Hall.
